content.div:
Sorry?

Sorry only goes so far.

Why apologize when you can make it up to everyone, or at least the LMFAO fans of the world -- so, basically everyone -- by releasing something they can all enjoy: a music video, one featuring inflatable zebras and free-flowing Ciroc and fat-suits and Kid 'N' Play (?!) and more neon pants than the contents of a Zubaz warehouse.

"Sorry For Party Rocking," the video for LMFAO's latest single is here, disturbing the neighbours for more than seven minutes with a house party that apparently picked up from where Katy Perry's "Last Friday Night" left off, then added a David Hasselhoff cameo. As for the people next door, they're also played by duo's RedFoo and Sky Blu (in performances that owe much to the grand comedic tradition of White Chicks and Big Momma's House), and when old man RedFoo has enough with all the after-hours "Wiggling" and "Shuffling" going on, he calls the cops on the party. Further Wiggling and Shuffling -- and product spots for assorted LMFAO-related goods -- ensues.

The video is directed by Mickey Finnegan, who also took charge of LMFAO's past videos, "Party Rock Anthem," "Champagne Showers" and "Sexy and I Know It," works of epic nonsense, every one.

"We treat our music videos like movies," LMFAO's RedFoo told Dose.ca in December, saying that he and Sky Blu are hoping to get into making actual movies sooner than later. "Me and Sky have always been interested in acting and doing skits ...and Improv Olympics, I went to Improv Olympics and graduated from there, used to do stand-up comedy, been in a few independent films so itâ€™s fun to, you know, play characters and just entertain people."

Watch "Sorry For Party Rocking" below:

leahc@dose.ca

source.title: Watch Sorry For Party Rocking; No Need to Apologize, LMFAO

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj's new album won't arrive until April, two months later than it was expected to drop. To help cushion the blow, Minaj premiered a new video for "Stupid Hoes." Watch it here.
link.title: Nicki Minaj Debuts 'Stupid Hoe' Video, Pushes Album Release To April

link.Abstract: Elton John's husband, David Furnish, trashed Madonna on Facebook after she won the Golden Globe for Best Original Song.
link.title: Elton John and David Furnish Slam Madonna's Golden Globe Win

link.Abstract: What does Madonna have to say about love, marriage and Nicki Minaj? Find out in our round-up of the best quotes from her interview with ABC News. The two-parter wrapped Jan. 13 on Good Morning America.

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj released new song "Stupid Hoe" today. The lyrics would seem to confirm that she'll appear at the Super Bowl with Madonna (and also that she thinks someone is a "stupid hoe").
